intro: Linaria alpina var. flaviflora, commonly known as the Alpine toadflax, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bright yellow, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine gardens.
